scenes.background: The team has successfully completed an important project, and everyone is excited to organize a celebration. However, there are differing opinions on how to celebrate. Colleague Sam suggests going to a bar for a lively party, Emma prefers a formal dinner, and Ryan proposes an outdoor team-building activity.
scenes.description: Everyone is looking at you to make the final decision.

options.text: How about we do a bit of everything? Start with an outdoor activity, then have dinner, and end the night at a bar.
options.analysis: This option shows a high level of emotional detection and empathy by considering everyone's preferences. It also demonstrates good social skills and motivation.

options.text: I think a formal dinner would be a great way to celebrate our success. It will give us a chance to relax and reflect on our achievements.
options.analysis: This choice shows good self-regulation and social skills, but slightly lower empathy as it prioritizes one suggestion over others.

options.text: Let's vote on each option and go with the majority's choice to ensure everyone feels included.
options.analysis: This option reflects empathy and emotional detection by including everyone's opinion, but shows lower motivation as it avoids making a decisive call.
